oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Rock House Holiness Church service, 1999 April 18
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording of a small service that opens with a song by Joyce Summerford followed by dancing by J. L. Dyal. The service, which gets off to a slow start, picks up after Rayford Dunn preaching and delivering the line, "He's still here." The service also features laying on of hands, testimony by Bill Pelfry, Billy Summerford, and J. L. Dyal.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Appalachian Region, Southern -- Religious life and customs; Dance -- Religious aspects; Extemporaneous preaching; Gifts, Spiritual; Glossolalia; Imposition of hands; Singing -- Religious aspects; Snake cults (Holiness churches) -- Appalachian Region, Southern; Witness bearing (Christianity)
Dunn, Rayford; Dyal, J. L.; Lynn, Bobby Sue; Pelfrey, Bill; Summerford, Billy; Summerford, Joyce
Rock House Holiness Church (Sand Mountain, Ala.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Rock House Holiness Church field recordings, 1996-2004
Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson field recordings, interviews, and photographs
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson Holiness Churches of Appalachia recordings and interviews
